topo.data_processing package

Submodules

topo.data_processing.data_processing module

topo.data_processing.data_processing.parse_csv(file_like, config)[source]
Read a CSV (file-like object) into a 2D NumPy array of objects:

  • float for numeric entries (converted to config.input_units),

  • np.nan for ‘X’ (missing),

  • ‘B’ for boundary.

topo.data_processing.data_processing.find_min_value(data)[source]

Find the minimum numeric value in the array, ignoring boundaries (‘B’) and np.nan.

topo.data_processing.data_processing.get_unit_conversion_factor(from_unit, to_unit)[source]

Get the conversion factor between different units of measurement.

topo.data_processing.data_processing.transform_data(data, config)[source]

Transform the data according to configuration settings.

This includes: - Shifting values so minimum is 0 (if config.apply_transform is True) - Converting units from input to output units - Rounding to specified precision (if config.rounding is not None)

Parameters:

  • data – 2D NumPy array of elevation data

  • config (TopoConfig) – Configuration object with transformation settings

topo.data_processing.data_processing.find_max_value(data)[source]

Find the maximum numeric value in the array, ignoring boundaries (‘B’) and np.nan.
